module.name: pascodegen
module.short: Utility unit to generate pascal code
module.descr: pascodegen is a unit with a class that can be used to generate pascal code. it offers the class which has some utility methods for indenting code, offers logging and automatic handling of code sections or blocks (variable, constant etc.) The resulting code is available in a stringlist.

element.name: DefaultDottedDefine
element.short: Default compiler define for dotted unit support
element.descr: DefaultDottedDefine contains the default compiler define that is used for dotted units support. It is set to FPC_DOTTEDUNITS.

descr.p: TCodegenLogType defines the types of log messages that can be generated by the code generator.

element.name: TCodegenLogTypes
element.descr: TCodegenLogTypes is a set type based on enumeration. It allows specifying which types of log messages should be processed.

element.name: TCodeGeneratorLogEvent
element.short: Event handler type for logging messages
element.descr: TCodeGeneratorLogEvent is an event handler type used for logging messages from the code generator. It receives the sender object, log type and message text.

element.name: TCodeGeneratorLogEvent.Sender
element.short: Object that triggered the log event

descr.p: TCodeSection defines the different types of sections that can appear in Pascal code.
TDottedUnitsSupport defines the level of support for dotted unit names.

dl.dd: Do not enable support for dotted units
Split uses in dotted and non-dotted
Split uses in dotted and non-dotted, allow unit name to be dotted as well

element.name: TDottedUnitsSupport.dusUses
element.short: Support dotted units in uses clause

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator
element.descr: TPascalCodeGenerator is a class that provides functionality for generating Pascal code. It offers utility methods for code indentation, section management, logging and automatic handling of code blocks. The resulting generated code is available in a string list accessible through the property. The class supports dotted unit names and provides configurable keyword escaping.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Create
element.short: Create new Pascal code generator instance
element.descr: Create initializes a new TPascalCodeGenerator instance. It creates internal string lists for source code, license text and compiler switches. The default compiler switches MODE ObjFPC and H+ are automatically added.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Destroy
element.descr: Destroy frees all internal string lists and cleans up the TPascalCodeGenerator instance.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.EnsureSection
element.short: Ensure code is in specified section
element.descr: EnsureSection ensures that the current code section is set to the specified section type. If the current section is different from the requested section, it outputs the appropriate section keyword (Const, Type, Var, Resourcestring) and updates the current section.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.PushSection
element.descr: PushSection pushes a section onto the internal section stack. This allows nesting of sections and later restoration using .

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.PopSection
element.descr: PopSection pops the topmost section from the internal section stack and returns it. If the stack is empty, it returns csUnknown.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.CreateHeader
element.descr: CreateHeader generates the interface header section of a Pascal unit. This includes the license text comment, optional timestamp, compiler switches, interface keyword and uses clause with support for dotted unit names.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.CreateUnitClause
element.descr: CreateUnitClause generates the unit clause at the beginning of a Pascal unit. It handles dotted unit support by conditionally generating the appropriate unit name.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Indent
element.descr: Indent increases the current indentation level by adding two spaces to the internal indentation string. Subsequent calls to will use this increased indentation.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Undent
element.descr: Undent decreases the current indentation level by removing two spaces from the internal indentation string. If the indentation string is empty, no action is taken.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.IsKeyWord
element.short: Check if string is Pascal keyword
element.descr: IsKeyWord checks if the given string is a Pascal language keyword. It performs a case-insensitive comparison against a complete list of Pascal keywords including reserved words, operators and built-in identifiers.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.IsKeyWord.Result
element.short: True if string is a keyword

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.EscapeKeyWord
element.descr: EscapeKeyWord escapes a string if it is a Pascal keyword by adding prefix and suffix characters. If the string is a keyword, it adds the configured and or an ampersand (&) if ForceAmpersand is True.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.EscapeKeyWord.ForceAmpersand
element.short: Force ampersand prefix instead of configured prefix/suffix

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.MakePascalString
element.short: Convert string to Pascal string literal
element.descr: MakePascalString converts a string to a proper Pascal string literal by escaping single quotes. All single quotes in the input string are doubled to create valid Pascal string syntax. Optionally, the result can be wrapped in quotes.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.PrettyPrint
element.descr: PrettyPrint formats a string by capitalizing the first character and leaving the rest unchanged. If the input string is empty, it returns an empty string.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.AddLn
element.short: Add line to source code with current indentation
element.descr: AddLn adds one or more lines to the generated source code with the current indentation level applied. It supports adding single lines, arrays of strings, string lists or formatted strings. Each line is prefixed with the current indentation.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Comment
element.descr: Comment adds comments to the generated source code. It supports single line comments (using // or { }) and multi-line comments using curly braces. For single strings, the Curly parameter determines the comment style. For arrays of strings or string lists, multi-line curly brace comments are generated.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Comment.Curly
element.short: Use curly braces instead of double slash

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.ClassComment
element.descr: ClassComment adds a formatted comment header for a class with decorative lines. It creates a professional-looking separator with the class name centered.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.ClassHeader
element.descr: ClassHeader adds a class header comment. This method is deprecated in favor of .

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.SimpleMethodBody
element.descr: SimpleMethodBody generates a complete method body with begin/end block and proper indentation. It adds an empty line, then 'begin', indents and adds the provided lines, undents and adds 'end;', followed by another empty line.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.SimpleMethodBody.Lines
element.short: Array of lines for method body

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.SaveToStream
element.short: Save generated source code to stream
element.descr: SaveToStream saves the generated source code to the specified stream. The entire content of the string list is written to the stream.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.SaveToFile
element.short: Save generated source code to file
element.descr: SaveToFile saves the generated source code to the specified file. If no output unit name is set and the source is empty, it automatically sets the output unit name based on the filename.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Source
element.descr: Source contains the generated source code as a read-only string list. Each line in the list represents one line of generated Pascal code. This property provides access to the complete generated output.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.CurrentSection
element.descr: CurrentSection indicates the current section type being generated. Reading this property returns the section type at the top of the section stack. Writing to this property changes the current section without affecting the stack.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.OutputUnitName
element.descr: OutputUnitName specifies the name of the Pascal unit being generated. This name is used in the unit clause and can be automatically derived from the filename when saving.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.ExtraUnits
element.descr: ExtraUnits contains additional units to include in the uses clause for non-dotted unit support. These units are added to the base units when generating the interface uses clause.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DottedExtraUnits
element.short: Additional units for dotted uses clause
element.descr: DottedExtraUnits contains additional units to include in the uses clause for dotted unit support. These units are added to the dotted base units when generating the interface uses clause with dotted units.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DottedDefine
element.descr: DottedDefine specifies the compiler define used for conditional compilation of dotted units. If not set, it defaults to .

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DottedUnitsSupport
element.descr: DottedUnitsSupport determines how dotted unit names are supported in the generated code. This affects both the uses clause generation and unit name handling.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.LicenseText
element.descr: LicenseText contains the license text that will be included as a comment at the beginning of the generated unit. This text is output by .

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.Switches
element.descr: Switches contains a list of compiler switches that will be included in the generated unit header. By default, it includes MODE ObjFPC and H+ switches.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.OnLog
element.descr: OnLog is an event that is triggered when the code generator wants to log information or warnings. Assign an event handler to receive these messages for debugging or user feedback.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.AddTimeStamp
element.short: Whether to include timestamp in header
element.descr: AddTimeStamp determines whether a timestamp comment is added to the generated unit header. When True, includes a 'Generated on:' comment with the current date and time.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.KeywordSuffix
element.descr: KeywordSuffix specifies the suffix string to append to escaped Pascal keywords. This is used by when ForceAmpersand is False.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.KeywordPrefix
element.descr: KeywordPrefix specifies the prefix string to prepend to escaped Pascal keywords. By default, this is set to '&' and is used by when ForceAmpersand is False.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.BaseUnits
element.short: Get base units for uses clause
element.descr: BaseUnits returns the base units to include in the uses clause for non-dotted unit support. This is a virtual method that descendants can override to provide specific base units. The default implementation returns an empty string.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DottedBaseUnits
element.short: Get base units for dotted uses clause
element.descr: DottedBaseUnits returns the base units to include in the uses clause for dotted unit support. This is a virtual method that descendants can override to provide specific dotted base units. The default implementation returns an empty string.

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DottedBaseUnits.Result
element.short: Comma-separated list of dotted base units

element.name: TPascalCodeGenerator.DoLog
element.descr: DoLog triggers the event if an event handler is assigned. It supports both simple messages and formatted messages with arguments.
